description: Construction of a detached two storey 4 x bed single family dwelling-house with associated car parking space, refuse and cycle storage
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990
| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s):- SO-833-01; SO-833-02 REV.B; SO-833-03 REV.A; SO-833-04 REV.B; SO-833-05 REV.B; SO-833-06 REV.A;

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Notwithstanding any information submitted with this application, details of the materials to be used for the external surfaces shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development hereby approved is commenced. The details shall be fully implemented as approved.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with the Council's adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) policies 7.4 and 7B, policies 1.1 (h), 1.2 (g) and 2.10 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016). | Prior to first occupation, the refuse and recycling storage areas shown in the submitted drawings shall be implemented and retained thereafter.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013, policies 1.1 (e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and The London Plan (2015) policy 5.16. | No part of the flat roofs of the hereby approved development shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof terrace/garden or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 7B and 7D of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013). | The rooflights hereby approved shall be a 'conservation rooflight' which lies flat in the roof and does not project beyond the roof plane.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4, 7.6 AND 7.8 of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | The proposed upper floor windows in the side elevations of the each dwellinghouse/development hereby approved shall contain only obscured glass (minimum level 3 obscure glazed) and non-opening unless the parts of the windows can be opened are more than 1.7 metres above the floor of the rooms in which the windows are installed. The windows so approved shall be retained permanently.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties, in accordance with policy 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1 (g), 2.1 (c) and 2.10 of the Adopted Core Strategy (2012) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016). | No windows or other openings (other than those shown on the approved plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2015), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (as amended), or any other order revoking and re-enacting that order, with or without modifications, no works shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of occupiers of adjoining properties and the appearance of the streetscene, in accordance with policies 1.1 (g) and (h) of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy (2012), and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and policies Ealing Local Variation of London Plan Policy 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013). | The car parking space shown on the approved plans shall be laid out prior to first occupation of any of the dwellinghouse hereby permitted and permanently retained without obstruction.

Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking within the site in accordance with policy 6.13 of the London Plan (2016). | Prior to the commencement of development, a Construction Management Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The plan shall include the following:
Details of construction hours;

A restriction that the footpath and carriageway on Edgehill Road is not blocked during construction. No encroachment on the clear space needed to maintain the safe and uninterrupted flow of road users and pedestrians;
Noise mitigation and monitoring measures;
Details of enclosure of working areas and the location of compounds for the storage of plant and materials;
Site security during construction;
A detailed statement relating to the excavation and construction of the basement. The statement shall include details of:
i.	Phasing and programming
ii.	Removal of earth from site
iii.	Construction methods
iv.	Site management and access
v.	Vehicle and machinery specifications
vi.	Numbers / frequency of vehicles/deliveries.

vii.	Noise/Vibration mitigation measures. Information submitted should directly cross-reference with the BPM & mitigation measures as detailed in the BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise.
Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents.

The Construction Management Plan shall be implemented on commencement of any works on site and the site shall be managed in accordance with the approved plan for the duration of demolition and construction.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (f) (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013) and policy 6.3 of the London Plan (2016).
